title: HTML
description: HTML is the basic building block of web pages. It defines the structure and content of a webpage by using tags like headings, paragraphs, images, links, lists, and more. Without HTML, there would be no web pages.

title: CSS
description: Cascading Style Sheets — it styles the web pages by controlling colors, fonts, layouts, spacing, and overall look.

title: JAVASCRIPT
description: A programming language that makes web pages interactive — adding animations, handling user actions, and communicating with servers.

title: AXIOS
description: A JavaScript library to easily send HTTP requests (like GET or POST) to fetch or send data to servers.

title: TAILWIND
description: A utility-first CSS framework that lets you design directly in your HTML using small classes for margins, colors, fonts, and more — making styling faster and more flexible.

title: BOOTSTRAP
description: A popular CSS and JavaScript framework with pre-built components like buttons, navbars, and grids, helping you build responsive and consistent websites quickly.
